title: Unsuffixed literals in C-like enums cause `multiple applicable method` errors
body:
It appears to be an unfortunate interaction between the AST-only nature of syntax extensions, and the error that occurs with (for example) `1.to_str()`. Note that fixing this requires putting a suffix on every literal, i.e. `1u`, `2u` below.

``` rust
#[deriving(IterBytes)]
enum Foo {
    A = 1,
    B = 2,
}

fn main() {}
```

```
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 error: multiple applicable methods in scope
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #1 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #2 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #3 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #4 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #5 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #6 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #7 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #8 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #9 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #10 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 error: multiple applicable methods in scope
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #1 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #2 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #3 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #4 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #5 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #6 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #7 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #8 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #9 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1:11: 1:20 note: candidate #10 is `std::to_bytes::__extensions__::iter_bytes`
c_enum_iterbytes.rs:1 #[deriving(IterBytes)]
                                 ^~~~~~~~~
error: aborting due to 2 previous errors
```
